title: Summer driving tips from AAA
text: Summer driving tips from AAA Comment Posted Jul. 15, 2015 at 3:00 PM Updated at 4:01 PM Posted Jul. 15, 2015 at 3:00 PM Updated at 4:01 PM A little advance planning for road trips can save time and trouble on down the highway. Here are some tips from AAA: • Check your vehicle’s payload capacity, that is, the maximum combined weight of all cargo and passengers that can safely be carried. You can typically find this figure on a sticker attached to the driver’s door of the vehicle. • Limit any load on top of your vehicle to a maximum of 18” in height and no more than 100 pounds. • Do not overload the trunk or rear cargo compartment. Items in a vehicle’s open cargo area or on the roof should be properly secured to prevent shifting of the load. The Daily Ardmoreite Posted Jul. 15, 2015 at 3:00 PM Updated at 4:01 PM
